title: Groom who got cold feet on his wedding day is dragged to ceremony in chains by fuming bride

A furious bride dragged her begrudging groom to their wedding ceremony in chains after he got cold feet and ran off. 
The man was filmed begging to be let go as his bride put his hands in chains and pulled him along the road. 
He hadn't even changed into his suit and was still wearing his casual clothes when he was spotted being dragged along by his hands. 
The woman, on the other hand, is already wearing her traditional white gown and is said to have been waiting at the altar for him for quite some time. The man was begging to be let go as he was dragged in chains along the road (Photo: AsiaWire) 
In the unbelievable clip, the woman shouts: "Are you going to marry me or not? Come back with me." 
The reluctant husband, who had apparently sneaked off without telling anyone, replies: "No, I wonâ€™t marry you. Let me go!" Read More Couple mistaken for mum and son reveal that a "damn freaky" sex life is secret to their happy relationship 
A large crowd of confused onlookers watched in the unnamed Chinese city as the woman then physically pulls him along the road by the chains on his wrists. The woman shouts: "Are you going to marry me or not?" before the groom replied: "No, let me go" (Photo: AsiaWire) 
The man is believed to have been taken back to the wedding venue, but reports carrying the shocking story did not say whether the unnamed pair did indeed tie the knot in the end. 
A video of the bizarre incident - believed to have taken place at the end of last year - has been viewed millions of times since it was posted on Chinese social media site Sina Weibo. Like us on Facebook
